intro: Centaurea hervieri, commonly known as the French centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring bright blue or purple ray florets surrounded by yellow disk florets. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Centaurea hervieri is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
